title.narrative: SAFE AND CLEAN ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: Evidence-based policies and plans are implemented to ensure a safe and clean environment, and children, adolescents and parents have the knowledge and skills to protect their environment and be safe and prepared for disaster response., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Innovation. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and adolescents benefit from increased utilization of equitable, quality health and nutrition services, and have practices that promote their health, well-being, safety and green living.

participating-org.narrative: CENTER FOR EMERGENCY SITUATIONS AND DISASTER RISK REDUCTION
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH OF KYZYLORDA O
SPC FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOCIAL REHABILITATION

sector.narrative: Institutional strengthening / policy support/awareness and or advocacy for climate change, environment, energy, climate, environment, disasters, energy and / or multi-thematic
Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)
Technical assistance--disaster risk reduction and / or climate change adaptation and / or environment
Water sector policy and administrative management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Evidence-based policies and plans are implemented to ensure a safe and clean environment, and children, adolescents and parentshave the knowledge and skills to protect their environment and be safe and prepared for disaster response.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF contributed to a number of high-level initiatives of the Parliament – the legislation for children with special needs – and the Government – the Strategy of the Ministry of Emergencies – in terms of the needs of children, including those with special needs, the Technical Working Group on Child Safety, of which UNICEF is a member, and the ‘Green Kazakhstan’ national project, where environmental education is prioritized. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: National Health strategies and plans with mainstreamed risk reduction/resilience, inclusive of climate change available (21-03-L3-17), Text

baseline.value: Air pollution and climate change mainstreamed to the draft State Health Development Programme for 2020-2025

target.value: 2022:Activities on climate change and quality of environment budgeted and monitored

actual.value: 2021:Yes. Healthy Nation Project includes risk reduction/resilience priority focusing on biological threats due to Covid-19. Activities on quality of environment are budgeted and monitored in the plan of the National Center of sanitary and epidemiological moni

title.narrative: National-level action plan on child safety/child injury prevention, Kazakhstan CO, Text

baseline.value: The inter-agency action plan on child safety is under development by the CP Committee under MoES

target.value: 2022:MTR of the Action plan; recommendations available

actual.value: 2021:The activities on child safety and injury prevention are mainstreamed into National Project Healthy Nation. Multisectoral TWG on child safety is established under NPHC in 2021 and UNICEF is part of it.
